ygData.subject: Re: Executioner Hood vs BI Crown
ygData.msgSnippet: The time the Lord wiped us all out he was actually bare fisted, no weapon at all. He was just too tough, the casters said their spells were resisted so it was
ygData.messageBody:
The time the Lord wiped us all out he was actually bare fisted, no weapon
at all.
He was just too tough, the casters said their spells were resisted so it
was left down to a bard and a Paladin to deal out the dmg. No chance.

Madagan

From: <kim@...>

On Mon, 14 Feb 2000 John_Senior@... wrote:
>
> I managed to get into the Lord group on sunday, after begging I could
> handle it (I was level 37) and that it was only the day before that I
spent
> the whole day camping the magi. The leader agreed and upon arriving to
the

The mana song goes far for advancing one's cause. :)

> I was already dual wielding Yaks after some fine fortune on friday
evening,
> I offered my sharkjaw Cutlass for a Yak and the guy accepted. I was so
> pleased, no I deal out a modest amount of dmg.

A lot of the double-attack folks in my guild are complaining
about the Yaks being a huge stamina drain (4.5 wt). They've
been trying to get Wakizashis instead (2.0 wt). The sharkjaw
cutlass would fall under the same category (2.0 wt I think).

> Spent 8 hours at the Lord camp sunday, made 2 bubs exp and hit level 38
> (yet another useless song). Only died once and that was because the Lord
> was too hard. Wiped all but 2 of us out (they gated out). Another group
> watched us die and didn't help, hoping they would get the kill but our
> cleric was bound next to the Lord room and managed to get the exp for us.
> In total we saw 2 Yaks and 6 SSB's. I lost every single roll <sigh> I
never
> rolled higher than a 62, what is wrong with me???

Heh heh. Told ya so. :) The levels required to hold the
room is much lower than the levels required to kill the lord
with a sword.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
